name: Dog Breeds in the Nonsporting Group Multiple Choice Quiz | Animals | 10 Questions

questions.text: This small black and white pug-nosed breed is an American creation, bred from pit bulls among others.
questions.explanation:
Boston terrier.

	The Boston terrier of a century ago was much larger.

questions.text: This breed could not now perform its original function even if it wanted to. Originally bred to fight cattle and bears, it is now a slow, lumbering, drooling, snoring and totally unagile creature.
questions.explanation:
Bulldog.

	Today's bulldogs almost always must be delivered by Caesarian section because their heads are so large. They have many heart, joint, breathing and eye difficulties.

questions.text: This breed comes in three sizes - toy, miniature and standard - and was originally bred to be a bird dog.
questions.explanation:
Poodle.

	There is no such thing as a 'Royal Standard'- it's a term coined by puppymillers.

questions.text: This wrinkly dog with a bluish tongue comes in three coat varieties- brushcoat, horsecoat and the rare bearcoat.
questions.explanation:
Shar Pei.

	The brushcoat is short, the horsecoat is bristly, and the bearcoat is longhaired and disqualified from shows.

questions.text: This breed was once widely used for food and fur, which perhaps explains its crusty and independent temper.
questions.explanation:
Chow Chow.

	The chow also comes in a short-coated variety, which is relatively uncommon.

questions.text: This Dutch dog with its splendid wolflike coat was once a barge guard.
questions.explanation:
Keeshond.

	Many Keeshonds grin when they greet people. The Schipperke is Belgian.

questions.text: This breed comes in a variety of colors. It is known for its snub nose and huge ears, known as 'bat ears'.
questions.explanation:
French Bulldog.

	It is much smaller than the English bulldog.

questions.text: This russet-colored dog was bred for hunting birds. It stood at the base of the tree where the bird was perched and barked until the hunter came. As a pet, nonstop barking can be a problem!
questions.explanation:
Finnish Spitz.

	Their devotees know them as 'Finkies'

questions.text: This dog resembles an Akita in miniature.
questions.explanation:
Shiba Inu.

	Japan has a variety of dogs- from the small Shiba through the medium-sized breeds like the Hokkaido to the large Akita, they look very similar.

questions.text: This dog was bred to warn of strangers at Buddhist temples in Tibet.
questions.explanation:
Lhasa Apso.

	Huge Tibetan mastiffs actually guard the temples from intruders.
